reviewText:
As a fan of Classical Baby products, I worried that "Poetry" might be too advanced for my toddler.  Nope.  She adores it.  Additionally, she re-enacts the scene on the dvd cover -- she lays on her stomach and 'reads' thick books while quoting the poetry to herself.

"Poetry" takes a difficult subject and brings it to toddler level, without watering it down.  The segments are interspersed with small children who explain the poems and explain how poetry works.  The animation exceeds industry standards.  As an adult, I've never liked poetry, but now I'm fascinated by it.  This dvd is phenomenal for both toddlers and adults.  I highly recommend "Classical Baby: Poetry".

My son, who has watched the other 3 Classical Baby DVDs for the past year and a half, absolutely loves the Poetry Show.  He asks us to play it for him all the time and has started to recite parts of it.

Watching my granddaughter enjoy the Classical Baby series has been sheer joy for me.  I was very disappointed in the Classical Baby Poetry DVD.  It did not measure up.  My granddaughter did not enjoy it at all.

This is a MUST BUY item.  We LOVE the Classical Baby series and this one is as good as the rest.  It's poetry is sooo lovely and it's such a wonderful way to expose your little ones (my son is two) to poetry and the beauty of synchronous rhyme.  It's truly lovely, I wish they'd make more!  The only con I see with this item is that I wish it were longer (it's only about 20 minutes total in length).
All Classical Baby shows - now including this one - are favorites of my daughter.  A welcome alternative to barely educational cartoons!
Love, love these. We had these taped on our DVR from HBO for years and then switched cable systems and lost the shows. I bought these when we had baby #2. Lovely and educational!
My grandson loved this collection!
the best.
Excellent

My 4 month old will watch this DVD all the way through happily. When she hears it on the TV she turns her head. When she is crying in the car and I turn this Poetry Show on she stops crying. She loves the Owl and the Pussy Cat the best. She also enjoys the children discussing Poetry.
It's one of those dvds where you don't feel too bad about plopping your kids in front of the tv. Educational and engrossing for the youngsters.

Beautiful and charming. G'kids love it and so do I ! Presently by children who comment on the "nature of poetry". The poems are well chosen representing variety from Frost ("Stopping by Woods..."to Edward Lear's "Owl and the Pussycat" to Shakespeare)and each is animated and narrated wonderfully by just the right voice for each selection ! Beautiful introduction to poetry! Highly recommend!
This video is amazing, littles ones are mesmerized. It is great to put on to calm down. Adults and children alike love this video. It is favorite to give as gifts.
A wonderful follow-up to Baby Music and Baby Dance.  It is an impressive collection of children describing poetry. I hope there are more of this series.
Another great video in the Classical Baby collection that we watched as a family with my small children.  They loved the rhythms, words, music and animation.  Very well done!
We absolutely love it !!! super fast shipping
ALL the other DVDs in the series are excellent.  This is a bit advanced for the audience.
I love this series as a gift for babies.

Got this for my 20 month old.  It says its for when "i'm all grown up now." not sure what age range this is for.  yes it is a little beyond her but she still seems to enjoy some of it.
I myself really like it.  Although I am not a fan  of background TV I totally could have this going in the background and be perfectly happy.  I will say that I'm not so keen on the commentary by the kids interrupting the nice poetry, but maybe if I were still a kid I would appreciate that more.
Baby's favorites are "Dance" and "Music."
Neither of us is much a fan of "Art."
This CD was a bedtime ritual between my grandson and I. It is absolutely wonderful. Every infant to young child should have it.

This Classical Baby line is clever and artistic. My baby, since around 5 or 6 months, has seen them all many times, and the graphics and music really grab her attention. I, too, am happy to watch these compared to a lot of other children's programs.  The Poetry show seems to be her favorite, I think because she gets a kick out of the children interviewed between the poems.
This is a delightful DVD.  I love to watch it as much as my toddler does!  Wonderful selections and excellently done.
Such a clever way to introduce poetry. The celebs who read the poems all do a wonderful job.

A MUST HAVE SHOW for your kids!!!  We love it!!!  And it has sparked a general love and interest of poetry among our children.  :)  I could do without the comments of the children between poetry.  I wish they just would've added more classic works of poetry.
I love this whole series
I bought because my 19 month old grandbaby could not get enough of baby one. Truly. Do bought because Amazon posted bought  together. But not a good idea. Would love more like the first baby one.
Grandson is mesmerized by this DVD.  Absolutely worth it!
Beautiful beautiful DVD. My 2 year old loves it. He recites quite a few poetry from this. Well worth the money!
love this series

My children loved all of the Baby Classical.  They would sit in front of the TV from infants & be glued to it.  It is also pleasant to listen to while you try to get somethings done while they are preoccupied.  Much better than listening to Dora or Barney.  I would rather get Classical Baby stuck in my head for the day than one of those.  They are now 5 & & YO and if I turn it on, they still sit & watch it.
Only half of the film is about the poetry itself, the other half is kids' thoughts in poetry. The poetry part is good but way too short than I expected.

Very good video, although my least favorite of the 4-series, which is exceptional and one of the best series.  Far exceeds typical baby-kids videos of today.  A taste of arts to be remembered.  Well done, HBO!
Won an Emmy for HBO  Outstanding children's Program. contains Parent tips on how to use
The best baby show I have ever seen. We have now watched this hundreds or more times. Perfect calm, educational and beautiful dvd.
Great - For older children, though!
Okay, but nothing compared to the Music, Art, and Dance trilogy that preceded it.

I love it. It is HBOs great production. Baby can listen to it and watch it again and again, and it is so well done, we do not mind repeating it for her, again and again. I love this DVD is excellent.
The only downside it is that if you live in Europe you need the kind of DVD that plays universally all formats.
But otherwise this is an excellent production.
What a wonderful way to grow a love for the classics in a young child. This is a beautiful DVD, and it makes a wonderful gift. It is perfectly appropriate for the very young child.
This is the best of the Classical Baby series.  The music and the graphics are as powerful as the words.  The combination is exquisite, compelling.  My grandchildren, aged 5 and 3, love this one.

When my grandson was an infant, my daughter found "Classical Baby - Poetry" on tv and DVRd it.  We watched it often because even though he was so young, my grandson seemed to hang on every word and smiled at the animation.  Two years later, my granddaughter was born and we played this wonderful show for both of them, together.  My granddaughter smiled throughout... and we both were especially enraptured with "My Valentine" by Gertrude Stein.  We have a shared love of ladybugs thanks to this poem.  No longer on DVR, I finally found the DVD and gave it to my granddaughter for her 5th birthday.  She loved it... and my grandson remembered very specific points of the show.  I highly recommend this collection of gently spoken, sweet poems with beautiful illustrations.  It's a calming show that holds young children's attention.  A nice change of pace from most of what is available for little ones.  It's a wonderful addition to any library.
This is more for a toddler age!! It's unlike all of the other Classical Baby's. HBO missed the mark with this one.

Great video. Not too long. Exposes kids to great poetry and beautiful animation. I also love that there are interviews with children, so my daughter gets to see their expressive faces as they talk about poetry.
Great illustration, music and poem! My 2.5 yo son can rarely focus on one DVD for too long, but this one just kept him interested from the beginning till the end. Money well spent.

The music is great and my son absolutely loves the animation. He is glued to the TV screen when I put the classical baby DVDs on. He smiles & happily claps along with the characters. each video is 30 mn and at his age that enough. I
We received our DVD classical baby the next day. Our baby loves this video! It is soothing and attention grabbing. It was in perfect condition and prompt delivery! Thank you!
Great video with wonderful illustrations and music! My son and nephews can't stop watching it.  We purchased the entire series
as the original series...has interviews with kids talking about how poetry makes you feel...very sweet but not in alignment with the others in this series
Really a great addition to the Classical Baby series. Our two-year-old loves watching it. It gives us something to talk about and interact together when watching.
It's sure hard to beat my kiddo learning words while watching this show.  She loves to dance and giggle while watching.

We like all the Classical Baby series. My 4 year old son loves Dance, Music, and Art. The poetry is entertaining, and has children older than my son, but I'm have yet to see a bunch of young kids who are deeply into poetry, meter, etc. But, it's a terrific video. Maybe you can use it to interest your kids in poetry...
My grandson has been watching them since he was 9 months old and just loves them.  We love them too. Exceptionally well done!
I love this DVD.  It is not just for children.  I have shared it with triends and family.  Thank you
2 years old son loves all classical baby collection. he doesn't seem to be interested in this dvd. contents are very good, but not appealing to my son.
Terrific introduction to poetry for children. My grandkids love it! I recommend this if you would like your children to have some degree of literacy and classical education

My baby loves the Classical Baby videos and my husband and I kind of enjoy watching them as well. She doesn't seem to like this one quite as much (it is aimed at an older audience, so she is a bit young for it), but it's still a really good addition to the Classical Baby collection. These videos are both educational and relaxing- the Poetry Show has similar qualities. It differs, however, because there are these super smart young kids explaining the elements of poetry and, at times, reading poetry (I love that my little munchkin will see these kids being excited about it!). I mostly liked the poetry choices, too.
I recommend this to parents.

I am not a poetry person but I do love this poetry DVD.]I appreciate watching the pictures / art. They are so beautiful and creative. My baby loves watching other children talk. She loves the songs. I wish the DVD can be longer. it feels like 15 minutes long to me.

The poetry edition is on par with the originals in nearly all ways.  My only dislike is the departure from animation when they interview kids in a sort of "Reading Rainbow" style.  Maybe my kids will like that as they get a bit older, but for now they just want music, words, and pretty colors.

It's a calm video that adults won't mind watching over and over. This is a really great series (the art and classical music ones, too). Our son even knows some of the lines of the poems which he says sometimes.
This video includes a good selection of poems read and illustrated in interesting ways. Some of the poems are very beautifully done. Great introduction to poetry.

This is the only video that she will watch (besides Caesar the dog whisper, because of all the cute dogs, lol!)
I think it's because:

 music and animation are calm and well made (not frenetic like most cartoons)
 there are short segments with young children (4-9 yrs old) where they speak about poems. IT'S GREAT!
 each poem is animated differently and it's short (2-3 minutes each) KEEPS HER INTEREST
 there's an animated child MC who introduces the poems
 it's less than 30 minutes in total length
 Celebrity voices and authors, singers, readers is a plus for parents.

We don't watch much TV. We are making it a point to avoid TV for our child (16 months old), but this is a wonderful family program, that we all watch together and we talk about it as it's running, so she's not being baby sat by the program.

it is ok, not as good as other ones.
But it is new, my kid still like to watch it every so often.

We baught the poetry and music dvds after we tried the dance and art. As I said in my other review, we are very pleased with them. I love the children discussing poetry and the selection of poetry on this dvd.
You can watch it with your kids for holiday time. It makes very peaceful moment and also same time you can introduce about the poetry to the kids.

My son has loved this since he was 4 months old. He's 11 months now and he will watch it three or more times if I keep playing it for him. He plays on the floor and looks up to watch the children commenting, and he definitely has his favorite "friends" in the show. I like it because it's got substantial content in an easy to digest format, and he probably won't develop ADD from this like he might from Sponge Bob. Or so I hear. I think it's great, and I hope there's a sequel. We have the entire Classical Baby set, but the Poetry Show is by far our favorite.

We have had the entire Classical Baby series since my daughter was born.  It's really good stuff.  Educational, artistic, fun to watch and really well done.  As an adult, I find myself sucked in every time we watch these.  There are four versions.  The Poetry Show is with out a doubt the most "verbal" of the lot with all of the wonderful spoken language brought to life with lovely art work.  All four have a calm manner about them, making them perfect for relaxation time or for watching during long car rides.  I honestly can't recommend these enough.  This is TV you won't feel guilty about letting your kids watch.
A priceless treasure to be enjoyed by viewers of all ages.  I saw The Poetry Show on HBO and just had to have it.  I enjoy it as much as my 3-year old does.

I like ALL of the Classical Baby series!!
Really appeals to our grandson... wonder how much he will retain... without being able to read.
I have probably learned more than he.

I bought three copies as Christmas presents for my nephews. None would play on an Australian player, only in North America. So I went back months later and bought 3x again.... this time making sure to select my region. Still no luck. 6 dud copies of this delightful DVD and I can't use any of them. Amazon should not be shipping products that are clearly unusable in my region.

This is an excellent product that I wish I found a few years ago as my daughter is now 4 1/2. Initially when I first opened it I watched it by myself, which I often do before handing over to my little ones as it is less of censoring but more to preparing myself for likely questions. When I first watched it I was worried that my daughter might not find it interesting enough as the graphics does feel like it's gear towards a younger audience. However, she watched it for the first time today and she was mesmerized!

Between each poem it showed interviews of little children's view about poetry, I think that makes my daughter feels more interested as the "I-want-to-know-because-other-kids-know" syndrome kicks in... Now, I cannot comment on how much longer this DVD can hold her attention as she has only watched it once, I plan to give this DVD to her every morning while she eats breakfast until she asks me to stop!

Each poem is beautifully read by actors, it is not "dumb-down" at all, especially the last poem How Do I Love Thee? (Sonnet 43) by Elizabeth Barrett Browning read by Gwyneth Paltrow moved me to tears when I watched it the first time.

One thing that I would love to have with this DVD is to have a booklet with all the poems/lyrics listed out for the parents, and even some analysis on each of the poems, as I have never learnt any of these poetries before (English is my second language) I will not be able to recite or teach my child the contents without the written copy in front of me. Because currently there is nothing, not even a list of the titles of the poetry is listed anywhere in the box except showing at the end of the video. I guess it is time for me to do some home work to make this DVD even more perfect!

I enjoy watching Classical Art, Music, and Dance with two of my grandchildren who visit frequently.  While only 2 and 3 1/2 years old, they barely move or make a sound while the DVDs are playing and always ask for "one more".  Classical Poetry is the perfect continuation of the series with the little baby "grown up".  My grandchildren seem to love the real children who make an appearance in this series.
In the Classical Art series, there is a Mary Cassatt painting of  a Mother and Child and my granddaughter saw immediately that the little girl looked quite like her.  I discovered that this painting was at the Metropolitan Museum and so I planned a day to visit the museum with her (the perfect follow-up to the DVD).  The photo of her standing by the painting is priceless.

We will be writing poetry next.  The Classical Baby Poetry DVD is such a great introduction to poetry - especially with all the different opinions about just what it is.

This video is loved by my grandchildren from ages 2to9 and also by me. The children are adorable in the video. Iit inspires you to love poetry and we love the poems and the actor/readers.  We are excited about all of the classical baby DVD's.

This is a wonderful addition to the "Classical Baby" collection...the poems, for the most part (I love Elizabeth Mitchell, but the "Grassy Grass Grass" poem by Woody Guthrie is just a little goofy), are read beautifully, and the children talking about poetry in between each animated segment are adorable.  There's this one kid with an English accent who is hilarious...VERY serious that "poetry is about YOU!"  I couldn't agree more.  My twins--21 months--go silent and still when I put this on.  Doesn't get better than that!

we have so many magical moments with these series!! we thought our 16 months old baby is too young for this but he just loved it from first sight! he is now 26 months and still this film is one of his favorites!
very well done, thumbs up!
we love giving this as a present as well..
My son is 18 months old and loves the Classical Baby movies (Art, Dance and Music).  So I bought this Poetry and he loves it as well.  Very cute dvd.

We own Classical Baby Art, Dance, Music and Poetry and have watched/listened to them now for 5 years without getting sick of them (of course with a few breaks in between).  They have now become my gift of choice to new parents.

I love thus video, and so does my toddler.
LOVES IT. Has started quoting some of the poems...
What a beautiful thing to fill your child's head with. Think about it.
I would give it 10 stars if I could!
The Poetry cd was a run away favorite for all ages: from 5 to 70.  My 5 y.o. grand-daughter said: "I love this.  It makes me feel calm."

Children talking about what poetry means to them? It might be interesting to their parents and teachers, but it doesn't make it entertaining for anyone else. The music is nice and keeps a child's attention, but much of the rest is boring.
I loved it, well done, good selection of poems. I would recomend it to every parent, as well all the selection classical baby. My children watches them almost once a month.

my 14-month-old has been watching this video since about 6-months of age, whenever i cut her nails.  it was also the only thing that calmed her down when we had to give her masked breathing treatments for an acute illness at 6-months.  she absolutely loves the brief kids' interviews and even favors one particular girl and boy; she gets giddy whenever they come on.  i find the short interviews (several seconds; up to 1/2 minute maybe?) to be wonderful transitions and good pacers.  the children actually seem quite bright.  i talk to my daughter about the video while cutting her nails; she has actually learned a lot of receptive language from the interactions.  my husband and i really like the variety of poetry and animation, as well as the different voices performing/reading the poetry.  very well presented.  we really, really, really, wish there were more poetry videos to come.  we also have the set of 3 (dance, art, music), but this one has always been the most captivating for our daughter.

I had the first three classical baby DVDs and wanted to get this one as well.  It was not disappointing and had everything I wanted for my baby. She is 15 months old and doesn't yet like the slower poems, like William Shakespeare, but when she is a little older, I think she will get into the groove. So, if you like the first three, you will like this one as well. It has poems, songs, and children reading poems or talking about poems. It even has a poem in Spanish, which is very beautifully read by Andy Garcia.

The Classical Baby: Poetry is putatively for children.  Granted, it is quite pleasant to watch - especially if you are a child.  But I think this production is more valuable for its contents and the value we might place on it, should we already know a little bit about poetry.  All the reviews on this site about this production are quite pleasant, but this one is written to the person that knows a few names and wants to know more.  How would you like to hear William Carlos Williams read HIS OWN poetry in his high, quavery voice, and then the entire (short) poem is repeated by a little girl - by memory.  Then Andy Garcia, whose Spanish is absolutely perfect, recites a poem about a butterfly.  Langston Hughes recites his poem about rain in April while children are seen playing in the rain - who could forget his voice?  And the finale is a mother rabbit telling her baby rabbit the Browning poem How Do I Love Thee - read by Gwyneth Paltrow!  It is truly a memorable finale for a fine video.  Look how much it costs!  Isn't that a STEAL for some of the greatest poetry ever written? If you have a child old enough to watch this production, you won't be sorry.  But don't let that stop you if you don't have children!  DO IT FOR YOURSELF!
I don't have any kids but watched this with my niece and now this is the #1 gift I get for expecting mothers. I loved this and they did a beautifully job on this video.

This is a very educational and entertaining poetry from HBO. My 2 years old love it especially the "Grassy grass grass". This is the only DVD that she would sit still and watch from start to end. We like it too! I would recommend this to every parents. You would not regret it.
This is a high quality product. We're very concerned about what we expose our son to and this HBO product meets the highest standards.

My baby is six years old, and I really enjoyed watching this with her just now.  I'm a bit non-plussed by the idea of actually sitting an infant down with it, but for a kid about the age of the actual kids reading some of the poems, I thought it was awesome.

I bought this for my daughter's second birthday.  She already has Dance, Art, and Music, which she adores.  She wanted to watch the Poetry DVD immediately again after her first viewing.  This DVD is often the first thing on her mind when she wakes up in the morning.  It is a bit shorter than the rest of the series and includes real children talking about poetry (the others in the series are completey animated).  Classical Baby is the best children's series I have found that appeals to both children and adults.
My two kids love this  and so do we! It's fun, great to listen and a sweet learning tool!
This DVD is great for kids who want to know what poetry is.  The poems cover a wide range of styles and the kids commentaries are nice.

I bought this CD for my little granddaughter when she was one year old.  She just turned two and this CD still casts a spell over her whenever we put it on!  "The Swing" and "How Do I Love Thee?" are her favorites, and she can quote several verses from the latter.

Gwyneth Paltrow:  if you ever read this review, I want you know that there is a little two-year-old girl who thinks you are simply wonderful!  Well, of course, she does think you are a Mommy Rabbit!

I came upon this on hbo yesterday by 'accident'. What a lovely accident! I was thoroughly entertained, soothed, and entranced by what I was hearing/seeing. It was touching to hear some of my favorite poems talked about by these sweet, bright chidren, sung, read by stars and the artists themselves. It was a TREAT that fed me to my soul
My kids love the Classical Baby series. It gives them a greater appreciation of art, classical music, dance and poetry. I would recommend to all parents to have in their collection.

had a great experience!  I had a problem with my shipping address and emailed about it, I got a phone call hours later and they corrected the problem (that was my fault, not theirs) and mailed it super fast.

My 3 month old baby loves this dvd.  I thought this would be too difficult for 3 months old, but she absolutely loves it.  She loves to listen to other older children talking and she talks back to them!  She watches attentively and laughs and giggles too.  We have Classical baby "Music", "Art", "Dance" and now "Poetry" which she enjoys all of them.  I wish there are more to the series and that they are longer than 30 min.

Like HBO's classical baby, the poetry show is wonderfully crafted. there are interviews with children and the usual animation that goes with the poem/music. celebrities voice the poems. a great introduction to poetry for both child and adult.  even though i have an infant i still play this dvd for her.
I use this DVD right now as part of my 10 month's bedtime routine.  The poems that are used are great, classics and the voiceovers are wonderful. It's a wonderful DVD to add to your collection.

I suggest that if you have small children (2 1/2 years old and up), buy the Classical Baby Poetry DVD. My son is fascinated by the images and poetry, and the classical music is very soothing for him. When he is more able to understand language, I'm sure he'll enjoy it even more!

I am a first grade teacher and I use this video to introduce my poetry unit.  My class loves it and asks to watch it over and over.  It really holds their interest.  They really like listening to what the children in the video say about poetry and they want to discuss the poems after viewing the video. As a teacher, you could not ask for more.

Forget babies, I play this for my mother who has Alzheimer's. We have all the Classical Baby DVDS and play at least one of them every day. I never get tired of them.

This video is for kids a little older, as it deals with poetry and words.

We also have Goodnight Moon, bedtime stories with footage of kids in between talking about their concept of sleep and dreams. It's very persuasive.

PLEASE HBO MAKE MORE OF THESE PROGRAMS!! These videos make great gifts for parents and little ones....or try it with the elderly, nursing homes, Alzheimer's units, senior day care centers. My mom loves little kids, so she can't get enough of these videos.
My grandchild will stop everything she is doing when I put this and the other "Show" titles on the tv! Very entertaining and educational. I like buying something that she gets so much out of!

We do not own the DVD, but we saved it to our DVR when it aired on HBO Family because our son loved the Classical Baby 2 (also aired on HBO, not purchased), which has art and music.  Though its format is different than the others - if you've read other reviews, you know that it has brief segments throughout with little children discussing poetry - my son LOVES this show as much, if not more, than the other Classical Baby shows.  It is full of animated segments with voiceovers by both celebrities and some of the singers / poets themselves (e.g., William Carlos Williams, Langston Hughes).  While I've never been a fan of the animation in this series, it's not for me, right??  My son really likes the animation.  And the poems are relatively kid-friendly and recited in a soothing tone.

My son has been watching this for so long that at 21 months, he asks for it by name.  "Want to watch 'The Poetry Show'!"  Now, I'm not proud that he's begging to watch TV, ha... but it sure beats Spongebob Squarepants!

We have had trouble getting our son to settle down at night for bedtime. This video and the other videos in the series were the trick for us. He would immediately sit down to watch and interact, and by the end of the show he'd be ready and willing to go to bed.
Another great DVD in the Classical Baby series.  I only wish, for their length, they were all on one DVD.
My son isn't into reading yet, so this was kind of a pre-emptive purchase. His mother and I like it a lot, though!

I bought this with my future grandson in mind.  But, when my current grandson, almost 4, saw it he wanted it, now.  He has memorized some of the poems already, less then a month later.  I think that is the highest recommendation a product can receive.
My daughter started watching these at 12 months and loves them.  I actually enjoy them more than any other baby programs too.  All of them are also great for watching before bed.

I loved the first three Classical Baby videos (Music, Dance, Art) and I love this one every bit as much. As always, the material is varied and captivating. I absolutely love having such a great way to share "culture" with my young children. (And I love to watch it, too.)

My daughter loves this DVD.  Its very calming and is great before nap-time or bed-time.  I only wish they had more poems and less commentary.  The commentary interrupted the flow of the DVD, but its still great.  I hope they make another one.

My baby is 9months old and she absolutely loves this DVD. In fact both she and I are glued to the TV when I play this DVD. Unlike the other 3 Classical Baby DVDs (they are all excellent), this one has 'interviews' of other kids about why they like poetry and what they think about it. My baby loves watching these kids as much as the animation. If you just get 2 of the 4 Classical Baby DVDs, I'd get the Music and Poetry.
This is wonderful for even tinest one.  Wish every child could hear this just before nap or bed.  So soothing and educational.  Love it.  JLG

My review title is a direct quote from my two-year old.

She loved the Classical Baby series so I just bought the Poetry edition without reading the reviews.  Everyone in our house enjoyed the first three DVDs so much that we gave sets away as baby gifts.

The animation and choice of material in the latest edition is lovely but my daughter absolutely HATED the segments showing children talking about poetry.  For that reason, the DVD really got really annoying really quickly.

I think if they'd stuck to the original format without inserting the kids, it would've been more enjoyable.

Maybe we'll have better luck next time.

I stumbled across this show on HBO, and instantly my 2 year old twins were mesmorized.  I set up my DVR to record the next showing of it, and it has been almost 6 months and they watch it all the time.  I have used it as a quiet time tool right before nap time.  The commentating by the kids on here are absolutely adorable. Very well thought out and intelectual for their age.  Anyway, I love it so much I bought the entire series.  We travel a bit, and it helps keep the car atmoshpere mellow.  Also, my 10 year old is an avid reader, and she came across a book "Hate That Cat" that referenced some of the poetry from the show.  She was so excited that she knew who William Carlos Williams was and that she knew some of his poems already.  The Poetry Show has helped to be a part of something special with all three of my kids.  Everyday my kids look forward to the Poetry Show. And all the Classical Baby shows. Highly recommended.

It is a truly beautiful introduction to an amazing array of poetry, letting your child know that poetry comes in many styles. The choice of poetry, the way it is read, the music and the images will leave you mesmerized. The comments by all the children are the icing on the cake.
My child enjoys this DVD a lot. Plus it is good for kid's ears to hear poems.

My son is two-years-old and he is not permitted to watch television. (I am a psychologist and have done research as to the correlation of ADHD and television viewing). However, I discovered The Poetry Show on HBO and recorded it for my son. He absolutely loves it. He is now able to completely recite the Owl and the Pussycat and will recite some limited Shakespeare. The children interviewed in this DVD are so sweet and cerebral. It truly inspires a parent to introduce their children to the arts at a young age. This DVD has quality animations, wonderful celebrity readings of classic poems and is an overall well-done piece. I would recommend this to anyone. I believe it spans children of all ages and captures the attention and interest of adults alike.

As a fan of Classical Baby products, I worried that "Poetry" might be too advanced for my toddler.  Nope.  She adores it.  Additionally, she re-enacts the scene on the dvd cover -- she lays on her stomach and 'reads' thick books while quoting the poetry to herself.

"Poetry" takes a difficult subject and brings it to toddler level, without watering it down.  The segments are interspersed with small children who explain the poems and explain how poetry works.  The animation exceeds industry standards.  As an adult, I've never liked poetry, but now I'm fascinated by it.  This dvd is phenomenal for both toddlers and adults.  I highly recommend "Classical Baby: Poetry".

My son, who has watched the other 3 Classical Baby DVDs for the past year and a half, absolutely loves the Poetry Show.  He asks us to play it for him all the time and has started to recite parts of it.

Watching my granddaughter enjoy the Classical Baby series has been sheer joy for me.  I was very disappointed in the Classical Baby Poetry DVD.  It did not measure up.  My granddaughter did not enjoy it at all.

This is a MUST BUY item.  We LOVE the Classical Baby series and this one is as good as the rest.  It's poetry is sooo lovely and it's such a wonderful way to expose your little ones (my son is two) to poetry and the beauty of synchronous rhyme.  It's truly lovely, I wish they'd make more!  The only con I see with this item is that I wish it were longer (it's only about 20 minutes total in length).
All Classical Baby shows - now including this one - are favorites of my daughter.  A welcome alternative to barely educational cartoons!
Love, love these. We had these taped on our DVR from HBO for years and then switched cable systems and lost the shows. I bought these when we had baby #2. Lovely and educational!
My grandson loved this collection!
the best.
Excellent

My 4 month old will watch this DVD all the way through happily. When she hears it on the TV she turns her head. When she is crying in the car and I turn this Poetry Show on she stops crying. She loves the Owl and the Pussy Cat the best. She also enjoys the children discussing Poetry.
It's one of those dvds where you don't feel too bad about plopping your kids in front of the tv. Educational and engrossing for the youngsters.

Beautiful and charming. G'kids love it and so do I ! Presently by children who comment on the "nature of poetry". The poems are well chosen representing variety from Frost ("Stopping by Woods..."to Edward Lear's "Owl and the Pussycat" to Shakespeare)and each is animated and narrated wonderfully by just the right voice for each selection ! Beautiful introduction to poetry! Highly recommend!
This video is amazing, littles ones are mesmerized. It is great to put on to calm down. Adults and children alike love this video. It is favorite to give as gifts.
A wonderful follow-up to Baby Music and Baby Dance.  It is an impressive collection of children describing poetry. I hope there are more of this series.
Another great video in the Classical Baby collection that we watched as a family with my small children.  They loved the rhythms, words, music and animation.  Very well done!
We absolutely love it !!! super fast shipping
ALL the other DVDs in the series are excellent.  This is a bit advanced for the audience.
I love this series as a gift for babies.

Got this for my 20 month old.  It says its for when "i'm all grown up now." not sure what age range this is for.  yes it is a little beyond her but she still seems to enjoy some of it.
I myself really like it.  Although I am not a fan  of background TV I totally could have this going in the background and be perfectly happy.  I will say that I'm not so keen on the commentary by the kids interrupting the nice poetry, but maybe if I were still a kid I would appreciate that more.
Baby's favorites are "Dance" and "Music."
Neither of us is much a fan of "Art."
This CD was a bedtime ritual between my grandson and I. It is absolutely wonderful. Every infant to young child should have it.

This Classical Baby line is clever and artistic. My baby, since around 5 or 6 months, has seen them all many times, and the graphics and music really grab her attention. I, too, am happy to watch these compared to a lot of other children's programs.  The Poetry show seems to be her favorite, I think because she gets a kick out of the children interviewed between the poems.
This is a delightful DVD.  I love to watch it as much as my toddler does!  Wonderful selections and excellently done.
Such a clever way to introduce poetry. The celebs who read the poems all do a wonderful job.

A MUST HAVE SHOW for your kids!!!  We love it!!!  And it has sparked a general love and interest of poetry among our children.  :)  I could do without the comments of the children between poetry.  I wish they just would've added more classic works of poetry.
I love this whole series
I bought because my 19 month old grandbaby could not get enough of baby one. Truly. Do bought because Amazon posted bought  together. But not a good idea. Would love more like the first baby one.
Grandson is mesmerized by this DVD.  Absolutely worth it!
Beautiful beautiful DVD. My 2 year old loves it. He recites quite a few poetry from this. Well worth the money!
love this series

My children loved all of the Baby Classical.  They would sit in front of the TV from infants & be glued to it.  It is also pleasant to listen to while you try to get somethings done while they are preoccupied.  Much better than listening to Dora or Barney.  I would rather get Classical Baby stuck in my head for the day than one of those.  They are now 5 & & YO and if I turn it on, they still sit & watch it.
Only half of the film is about the poetry itself, the other half is kids' thoughts in poetry. The poetry part is good but way too short than I expected.

Very good video, although my least favorite of the 4-series, which is exceptional and one of the best series.  Far exceeds typical baby-kids videos of today.  A taste of arts to be remembered.  Well done, HBO!
Won an Emmy for HBO  Outstanding children's Program. contains Parent tips on how to use
The best baby show I have ever seen. We have now watched this hundreds or more times. Perfect calm, educational and beautiful dvd.
Great - For older children, though!
Okay, but nothing compared to the Music, Art, and Dance trilogy that preceded it.

I love it. It is HBOs great production. Baby can listen to it and watch it again and again, and it is so well done, we do not mind repeating it for her, again and again. I love this DVD is excellent.
The only downside it is that if you live in Europe you need the kind of DVD that plays universally all formats.
But otherwise this is an excellent production.
What a wonderful way to grow a love for the classics in a young child. This is a beautiful DVD, and it makes a wonderful gift. It is perfectly appropriate for the very young child.
This is the best of the Classical Baby series.  The music and the graphics are as powerful as the words.  The combination is exquisite, compelling.  My grandchildren, aged 5 and 3, love this one.

When my grandson was an infant, my daughter found "Classical Baby - Poetry" on tv and DVRd it.  We watched it often because even though he was so young, my grandson seemed to hang on every word and smiled at the animation.  Two years later, my granddaughter was born and we played this wonderful show for both of them, together.  My granddaughter smiled throughout... and we both were especially enraptured with "My Valentine" by Gertrude Stein.  We have a shared love of ladybugs thanks to this poem.  No longer on DVR, I finally found the DVD and gave it to my granddaughter for her 5th birthday.  She loved it... and my grandson remembered very specific points of the show.  I highly recommend this collection of gently spoken, sweet poems with beautiful illustrations.  It's a calming show that holds young children's attention.  A nice change of pace from most of what is available for little ones.  It's a wonderful addition to any library.
This is more for a toddler age!! It's unlike all of the other Classical Baby's. HBO missed the mark with this one.

Great video. Not too long. Exposes kids to great poetry and beautiful animation. I also love that there are interviews with children, so my daughter gets to see their expressive faces as they talk about poetry.
Great illustration, music and poem! My 2.5 yo son can rarely focus on one DVD for too long, but this one just kept him interested from the beginning till the end. Money well spent.

The music is great and my son absolutely loves the animation. He is glued to the TV screen when I put the classical baby DVDs on. He smiles & happily claps along with the characters. each video is 30 mn and at his age that enough. I
We received our DVD classical baby the next day. Our baby loves this video! It is soothing and attention grabbing. It was in perfect condition and prompt delivery! Thank you!
Great video with wonderful illustrations and music! My son and nephews can't stop watching it.  We purchased the entire series
as the original series...has interviews with kids talking about how poetry makes you feel...very sweet but not in alignment with the others in this series
Really a great addition to the Classical Baby series. Our two-year-old loves watching it. It gives us something to talk about and interact together when watching.
It's sure hard to beat my kiddo learning words while watching this show.  She loves to dance and giggle while watching.

We like all the Classical Baby series. My 4 year old son loves Dance, Music, and Art. The poetry is entertaining, and has children older than my son, but I'm have yet to see a bunch of young kids who are deeply into poetry, meter, etc. But, it's a terrific video. Maybe you can use it to interest your kids in poetry...
My grandson has been watching them since he was 9 months old and just loves them.  We love them too. Exceptionally well done!
I love this DVD.  It is not just for children.  I have shared it with triends and family.  Thank you
2 years old son loves all classical baby collection. he doesn't seem to be interested in this dvd. contents are very good, but not appealing to my son.
Terrific introduction to poetry for children. My grandkids love it! I recommend this if you would like your children to have some degree of literacy and classical education

My baby loves the Classical Baby videos and my husband and I kind of enjoy watching them as well. She doesn't seem to like this one quite as much (it is aimed at an older audience, so she is a bit young for it), but it's still a really good addition to the Classical Baby collection. These videos are both educational and relaxing- the Poetry Show has similar qualities. It differs, however, because there are these super smart young kids explaining the elements of poetry and, at times, reading poetry (I love that my little munchkin will see these kids being excited about it!). I mostly liked the poetry choices, too.
I recommend this to parents.

I am not a poetry person but I do love this poetry DVD.]I appreciate watching the pictures / art. They are so beautiful and creative. My baby loves watching other children talk. She loves the songs. I wish the DVD can be longer. it feels like 15 minutes long to me.

The poetry edition is on par with the originals in nearly all ways.  My only dislike is the departure from animation when they interview kids in a sort of "Reading Rainbow" style.  Maybe my kids will like that as they get a bit older, but for now they just want music, words, and pretty colors.

It's a calm video that adults won't mind watching over and over. This is a really great series (the art and classical music ones, too). Our son even knows some of the lines of the poems which he says sometimes.
This video includes a good selection of poems read and illustrated in interesting ways. Some of the poems are very beautifully done. Great introduction to poetry.

This is the only video that she will watch (besides Caesar the dog whisper, because of all the cute dogs, lol!)
I think it's because:

 music and animation are calm and well made (not frenetic like most cartoons)
 there are short segments with young children (4-9 yrs old) where they speak about poems. IT'S GREAT!
 each poem is animated differently and it's short (2-3 minutes each) KEEPS HER INTEREST
 there's an animated child MC who introduces the poems
 it's less than 30 minutes in total length
 Celebrity voices and authors, singers, readers is a plus for parents.

We don't watch much TV. We are making it a point to avoid TV for our child (16 months old), but this is a wonderful family program, that we all watch together and we talk about it as it's running, so she's not being baby sat by the program.

it is ok, not as good as other ones.
But it is new, my kid still like to watch it every so often.

We baught the poetry and music dvds after we tried the dance and art. As I said in my other review, we are very pleased with them. I love the children discussing poetry and the selection of poetry on this dvd.
You can watch it with your kids for holiday time. It makes very peaceful moment and also same time you can introduce about the poetry to the kids.

My son has loved this since he was 4 months old. He's 11 months now and he will watch it three or more times if I keep playing it for him. He plays on the floor and looks up to watch the children commenting, and he definitely has his favorite "friends" in the show. I like it because it's got substantial content in an easy to digest format, and he probably won't develop ADD from this like he might from Sponge Bob. Or so I hear. I think it's great, and I hope there's a sequel. We have the entire Classical Baby set, but the Poetry Show is by far our favorite.

We have had the entire Classical Baby series since my daughter was born.  It's really good stuff.  Educational, artistic, fun to watch and really well done.  As an adult, I find myself sucked in every time we watch these.  There are four versions.  The Poetry Show is with out a doubt the most "verbal" of the lot with all of the wonderful spoken language brought to life with lovely art work.  All four have a calm manner about them, making them perfect for relaxation time or for watching during long car rides.  I honestly can't recommend these enough.  This is TV you won't feel guilty about letting your kids watch.
A priceless treasure to be enjoyed by viewers of all ages.  I saw The Poetry Show on HBO and just had to have it.  I enjoy it as much as my 3-year old does.

I like ALL of the Classical Baby series!!
Really appeals to our grandson... wonder how much he will retain... without being able to read.
I have probably learned more than he.

I bought three copies as Christmas presents for my nephews. None would play on an Australian player, only in North America. So I went back months later and bought 3x again.... this time making sure to select my region. Still no luck. 6 dud copies of this delightful DVD and I can't use any of them. Amazon should not be shipping products that are clearly unusable in my region.

This is an excellent product that I wish I found a few years ago as my daughter is now 4 1/2. Initially when I first opened it I watched it by myself, which I often do before handing over to my little ones as it is less of censoring but more to preparing myself for likely questions. When I first watched it I was worried that my daughter might not find it interesting enough as the graphics does feel like it's gear towards a younger audience. However, she watched it for the first time today and she was mesmerized!

Between each poem it showed interviews of little children's view about poetry, I think that makes my daughter feels more interested as the "I-want-to-know-because-other-kids-know" syndrome kicks in... Now, I cannot comment on how much longer this DVD can hold her attention as she has only watched it once, I plan to give this DVD to her every morning while she eats breakfast until she asks me to stop!

Each poem is beautifully read by actors, it is not "dumb-down" at all, especially the last poem How Do I Love Thee? (Sonnet 43) by Elizabeth Barrett Browning read by Gwyneth Paltrow moved me to tears when I watched it the first time.

One thing that I would love to have with this DVD is to have a booklet with all the poems/lyrics listed out for the parents, and even some analysis on each of the poems, as I have never learnt any of these poetries before (English is my second language) I will not be able to recite or teach my child the contents without the written copy in front of me. Because currently there is nothing, not even a list of the titles of the poetry is listed anywhere in the box except showing at the end of the video. I guess it is time for me to do some home work to make this DVD even more perfect!

I enjoy watching Classical Art, Music, and Dance with two of my grandchildren who visit frequently.  While only 2 and 3 1/2 years old, they barely move or make a sound while the DVDs are playing and always ask for "one more".  Classical Poetry is the perfect continuation of the series with the little baby "grown up".  My grandchildren seem to love the real children who make an appearance in this series.
In the Classical Art series, there is a Mary Cassatt painting of  a Mother and Child and my granddaughter saw immediately that the little girl looked quite like her.  I discovered that this painting was at the Metropolitan Museum and so I planned a day to visit the museum with her (the perfect follow-up to the DVD).  The photo of her standing by the painting is priceless.

We will be writing poetry next.  The Classical Baby Poetry DVD is such a great introduction to poetry - especially with all the different opinions about just what it is.

This video is loved by my grandchildren from ages 2to9 and also by me. The children are adorable in the video. Iit inspires you to love poetry and we love the poems and the actor/readers.  We are excited about all of the classical baby DVD's.

This is a wonderful addition to the "Classical Baby" collection...the poems, for the most part (I love Elizabeth Mitchell, but the "Grassy Grass Grass" poem by Woody Guthrie is just a little goofy), are read beautifully, and the children talking about poetry in between each animated segment are adorable.  There's this one kid with an English accent who is hilarious...VERY serious that "poetry is about YOU!"  I couldn't agree more.  My twins--21 months--go silent and still when I put this on.  Doesn't get better than that!

we have so many magical moments with these series!! we thought our 16 months old baby is too young for this but he just loved it from first sight! he is now 26 months and still this film is one of his favorites!
very well done, thumbs up!
we love giving this as a present as well..
My son is 18 months old and loves the Classical Baby movies (Art, Dance and Music).  So I bought this Poetry and he loves it as well.  Very cute dvd.

We own Classical Baby Art, Dance, Music and Poetry and have watched/listened to them now for 5 years without getting sick of them (of course with a few breaks in between).  They have now become my gift of choice to new parents.

I love thus video, and so does my toddler.
LOVES IT. Has started quoting some of the poems...
What a beautiful thing to fill your child's head with. Think about it.
I would give it 10 stars if I could!
The Poetry cd was a run away favorite for all ages: from 5 to 70.  My 5 y.o. grand-daughter said: "I love this.  It makes me feel calm."

Children talking about what poetry means to them? It might be interesting to their parents and teachers, but it doesn't make it entertaining for anyone else. The music is nice and keeps a child's attention, but much of the rest is boring.
I loved it, well done, good selection of poems. I would recomend it to every parent, as well all the selection classical baby. My children watches them almost once a month.

my 14-month-old has been watching this video since about 6-months of age, whenever i cut her nails.  it was also the only thing that calmed her down when we had to give her masked breathing treatments for an acute illness at 6-months.  she absolutely loves the brief kids' interviews and even favors one particular girl and boy; she gets giddy whenever they come on.  i find the short interviews (several seconds; up to 1/2 minute maybe?) to be wonderful transitions and good pacers.  the children actually seem quite bright.  i talk to my daughter about the video while cutting her nails; she has actually learned a lot of receptive language from the interactions.  my husband and i really like the variety of poetry and animation, as well as the different voices performing/reading the poetry.  very well presented.  we really, really, really, wish there were more poetry videos to come.  we also have the set of 3 (dance, art, music), but this one has always been the most captivating for our daughter.

I had the first three classical baby DVDs and wanted to get this one as well.  It was not disappointing and had everything I wanted for my baby. She is 15 months old and doesn't yet like the slower poems, like William Shakespeare, but when she is a little older, I think she will get into the groove. So, if you like the first three, you will like this one as well. It has poems, songs, and children reading poems or talking about poems. It even has a poem in Spanish, which is very beautifully read by Andy Garcia.

The Classical Baby: Poetry is putatively for children.  Granted, it is quite pleasant to watch - especially if you are a child.  But I think this production is more valuable for its contents and the value we might place on it, should we already know a little bit about poetry.  All the reviews on this site about this production are quite pleasant, but this one is written to the person that knows a few names and wants to know more.  How would you like to hear William Carlos Williams read HIS OWN poetry in his high, quavery voice, and then the entire (short) poem is repeated by a little girl - by memory.  Then Andy Garcia, whose Spanish is absolutely perfect, recites a poem about a butterfly.  Langston Hughes recites his poem about rain in April while children are seen playing in the rain - who could forget his voice?  And the finale is a mother rabbit telling her baby rabbit the Browning poem How Do I Love Thee - read by Gwyneth Paltrow!  It is truly a memorable finale for a fine video.  Look how much it costs!  Isn't that a STEAL for some of the greatest poetry ever written? If you have a child old enough to watch this production, you won't be sorry.  But don't let that stop you if you don't have children!  DO IT FOR YOURSELF!
I don't have any kids but watched this with my niece and now this is the #1 gift I get for expecting mothers. I loved this and they did a beautifully job on this video.

This is a very educational and entertaining poetry from HBO. My 2 years old love it especially the "Grassy grass grass". This is the only DVD that she would sit still and watch from start to end. We like it too! I would recommend this to every parents. You would not regret it.
This is a high quality product. We're very concerned about what we expose our son to and this HBO product meets the highest standards.

My baby is six years old, and I really enjoyed watching this with her just now.  I'm a bit non-plussed by the idea of actually sitting an infant down with it, but for a kid about the age of the actual kids reading some of the poems, I thought it was awesome.

I bought this for my daughter's second birthday.  She already has Dance, Art, and Music, which she adores.  She wanted to watch the Poetry DVD immediately again after her first viewing.  This DVD is often the first thing on her mind when she wakes up in the morning.  It is a bit shorter than the rest of the series and includes real children talking about poetry (the others in the series are completey animated).  Classical Baby is the best children's series I have found that appeals to both children and adults.
My two kids love this  and so do we! It's fun, great to listen and a sweet learning tool!
This DVD is great for kids who want to know what poetry is.  The poems cover a wide range of styles and the kids commentaries are nice.

I bought this CD for my little granddaughter when she was one year old.  She just turned two and this CD still casts a spell over her whenever we put it on!  "The Swing" and "How Do I Love Thee?" are her favorites, and she can quote several verses from the latter.

Gwyneth Paltrow:  if you ever read this review, I want you know that there is a little two-year-old girl who thinks you are simply wonderful!  Well, of course, she does think you are a Mommy Rabbit!

I came upon this on hbo yesterday by 'accident'. What a lovely accident! I was thoroughly entertained, soothed, and entranced by what I was hearing/seeing. It was touching to hear some of my favorite poems talked about by these sweet, bright chidren, sung, read by stars and the artists themselves. It was a TREAT that fed me to my soul
My kids love the Classical Baby series. It gives them a greater appreciation of art, classical music, dance and poetry. I would recommend to all parents to have in their collection.

had a great experience!  I had a problem with my shipping address and emailed about it, I got a phone call hours later and they corrected the problem (that was my fault, not theirs) and mailed it super fast.

My 3 month old baby loves this dvd.  I thought this would be too difficult for 3 months old, but she absolutely loves it.  She loves to listen to other older children talking and she talks back to them!  She watches attentively and laughs and giggles too.  We have Classical baby "Music", "Art", "Dance" and now "Poetry" which she enjoys all of them.  I wish there are more to the series and that they are longer than 30 min.

Like HBO's classical baby, the poetry show is wonderfully crafted. there are interviews with children and the usual animation that goes with the poem/music. celebrities voice the poems. a great introduction to poetry for both child and adult.  even though i have an infant i still play this dvd for her.
I use this DVD right now as part of my 10 month's bedtime routine.  The poems that are used are great, classics and the voiceovers are wonderful. It's a wonderful DVD to add to your collection.

I suggest that if you have small children (2 1/2 years old and up), buy the Classical Baby Poetry DVD. My son is fascinated by the images and poetry, and the classical music is very soothing for him. When he is more able to understand language, I'm sure he'll enjoy it even more!

I am a first grade teacher and I use this video to introduce my poetry unit.  My class loves it and asks to watch it over and over.  It really holds their interest.  They really like listening to what the children in the video say about poetry and they want to discuss the poems after viewing the video. As a teacher, you could not ask for more.

Forget babies, I play this for my mother who has Alzheimer's. We have all the Classical Baby DVDS and play at least one of them every day. I never get tired of them.

This video is for kids a little older, as it deals with poetry and words.

We also have Goodnight Moon, bedtime stories with footage of kids in between talking about their concept of sleep and dreams. It's very persuasive.

PLEASE HBO MAKE MORE OF THESE PROGRAMS!! These videos make great gifts for parents and little ones....or try it with the elderly, nursing homes, Alzheimer's units, senior day care centers. My mom loves little kids, so she can't get enough of these videos.
My grandchild will stop everything she is doing when I put this and the other "Show" titles on the tv! Very entertaining and educational. I like buying something that she gets so much out of!

We do not own the DVD, but we saved it to our DVR when it aired on HBO Family because our son loved the Classical Baby 2 (also aired on HBO, not purchased), which has art and music.  Though its format is different than the others - if you've read other reviews, you know that it has brief segments throughout with little children discussing poetry - my son LOVES this show as much, if not more, than the other Classical Baby shows.  It is full of animated segments with voiceovers by both celebrities and some of the singers / poets themselves (e.g., William Carlos Williams, Langston Hughes).  While I've never been a fan of the animation in this series, it's not for me, right??  My son really likes the animation.  And the poems are relatively kid-friendly and recited in a soothing tone.

My son has been watching this for so long that at 21 months, he asks for it by name.  "Want to watch 'The Poetry Show'!"  Now, I'm not proud that he's begging to watch TV, ha... but it sure beats Spongebob Squarepants!

We have had trouble getting our son to settle down at night for bedtime. This video and the other videos in the series were the trick for us. He would immediately sit down to watch and interact, and by the end of the show he'd be ready and willing to go to bed.
Another great DVD in the Classical Baby series.  I only wish, for their length, they were all on one DVD.
My son isn't into reading yet, so this was kind of a pre-emptive purchase. His mother and I like it a lot, though!

I bought this with my future grandson in mind.  But, when my current grandson, almost 4, saw it he wanted it, now.  He has memorized some of the poems already, less then a month later.  I think that is the highest recommendation a product can receive.
My daughter started watching these at 12 months and loves them.  I actually enjoy them more than any other baby programs too.  All of them are also great for watching before bed.

I loved the first three Classical Baby videos (Music, Dance, Art) and I love this one every bit as much. As always, the material is varied and captivating. I absolutely love having such a great way to share "culture" with my young children. (And I love to watch it, too.)

My daughter loves this DVD.  Its very calming and is great before nap-time or bed-time.  I only wish they had more poems and less commentary.  The commentary interrupted the flow of the DVD, but its still great.  I hope they make another one.

My baby is 9months old and she absolutely loves this DVD. In fact both she and I are glued to the TV when I play this DVD. Unlike the other 3 Classical Baby DVDs (they are all excellent), this one has 'interviews' of other kids about why they like poetry and what they think about it. My baby loves watching these kids as much as the animation. If you just get 2 of the 4 Classical Baby DVDs, I'd get the Music and Poetry.
This is wonderful for even tinest one.  Wish every child could hear this just before nap or bed.  So soothing and educational.  Love it.  JLG

My review title is a direct quote from my two-year old.

She loved the Classical Baby series so I just bought the Poetry edition without reading the reviews.  Everyone in our house enjoyed the first three DVDs so much that we gave sets away as baby gifts.

The animation and choice of material in the latest edition is lovely but my daughter absolutely HATED the segments showing children talking about poetry.  For that reason, the DVD really got really annoying really quickly.

I think if they'd stuck to the original format without inserting the kids, it would've been more enjoyable.

Maybe we'll have better luck next time.

I stumbled across this show on HBO, and instantly my 2 year old twins were mesmorized.  I set up my DVR to record the next showing of it, and it has been almost 6 months and they watch it all the time.  I have used it as a quiet time tool right before nap time.  The commentating by the kids on here are absolutely adorable. Very well thought out and intelectual for their age.  Anyway, I love it so much I bought the entire series.  We travel a bit, and it helps keep the car atmoshpere mellow.  Also, my 10 year old is an avid reader, and she came across a book "Hate That Cat" that referenced some of the poetry from the show.  She was so excited that she knew who William Carlos Williams was and that she knew some of his poems already.  The Poetry Show has helped to be a part of something special with all three of my kids.  Everyday my kids look forward to the Poetry Show. And all the Classical Baby shows. Highly recommended.

It is a truly beautiful introduction to an amazing array of poetry, letting your child know that poetry comes in many styles. The choice of poetry, the way it is read, the music and the images will leave you mesmerized. The comments by all the children are the icing on the cake.
My child enjoys this DVD a lot. Plus it is good for kid's ears to hear poems.

My son is two-years-old and he is not permitted to watch television. (I am a psychologist and have done research as to the correlation of ADHD and television viewing). However, I discovered The Poetry Show on HBO and recorded it for my son. He absolutely loves it. He is now able to completely recite the Owl and the Pussycat and will recite some limited Shakespeare. The children interviewed in this DVD are so sweet and cerebral. It truly inspires a parent to introduce their children to the arts at a young age. This DVD has quality animations, wonderful celebrity readings of classic poems and is an overall well-done piece. I would recommend this to anyone. I believe it spans children of all ages and captures the attention and interest of adults alike.
Excellent content of poems. Great for ages 4 and up.
This is another great video for young children, does not disappoint!

We have a 14 month old baby who is mesmerized by this poetry video. It soothes her and she loves the childrens segments. She lights up when they come into the screen as if her best friend just showed up. She has been enjoying this video for months. It's so calming in this fast paced, loud world, for us too.
Fantastic way to educate babies. My grandson pays particular attention, loves the music, the rhythm and the cartoons. When he's talking, I'm sure he'll be quoting Frost.

My grandoughter is a bit too young to understand poetry but she enjoys watching and listening to the kids. I absolutely love seeing the poetry visualized and the children featured in the video are extremly creative, smart and enjoyable to watch.

What a great way to introduce poetry to kids!!! I've loved the Classical Baby series as much as my kids ever did, and I've watched this one on my own as many times as I have with my children! A great mix of literature, art, music, and acting.
My baby loves this!

My 2 year old granddaughter loves this show. She even says some of the poems along with the show.  The selection of poetry is excellent and the celebrity readers do a wonderful job.  My granddaughter finds the poetry soothing and we watch it around bed time or quiet time.

Increased my children's appreciation for wordplay. Great selection of classic and lesser known poems. Some of the poems were not read clearly enough, but the graphics compensate for that. The short interviews with children interspersed between the poems were quite interesting.
My babies love this video.
